formElement.label: Configuration Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: Wlst Script Absolute Path:
formElement.documentation: Absolute path to WLST. i.e: '/path/to/wlst.cmd' or 'wlst.sh'.

formElement.label: Application Name:
formElement.documentation: Deployment name to assign to a newly-deployed application or standalone module. i.e: 'webapp'.

formElement.label: Application Path:
formElement.documentation: Absolute path of the application to deploy. i.e: '/path/to/webapp.war' or 'c:/mydir/webapp.war'.

formElement.label: Targets:
formElement.documentation: Targets on which to deploy the application or module (comma-separated list of the target servers, clusters, or virtual hosts).

formElement.label: Stage mode
formElement.documentation: Staging mode for the application you are deploying. (Notes: Drop-down values: stage, nostage, and external_stage. Ref: http://docs.oracle.com/middleware/12212/wls/DEPGD/deploy.htm#DEPGD235)

formElement.label: Deployment plan content
formElement.documentation: A WebLogic Server deployment plan is an XML document that you use to configure an application for deployment to a specific WebLogic Server environment.

formElement.label: Deployment plan path
formElement.documentation: Path to read a deployment plan (if there is one) or to save a new one from the Deployment plan content parameter.

formElement.label: Additional Options
formElement.documentation: Comma-separated list of deployment options, specified as name-value pairs. Refer to WLST deploy documentation (The options, which are not included in this form).

formElement.label: Archive version
formElement.documentation: Archive version number. Is used for production redeployment, specifies the application version which is going to be retired, while versionIdentifier specifies a new version. Archive version stays along with the new one.

formElement.label: Retire gracefully
formElement.documentation: Retirement policy to gracefully retire an application only after it has completed all in-flight work. This policy is only meaningful for stop and redeploy operations and is mutually exclusive to the retire timeout policy.

formElement.label: Retire timeout
formElement.documentation: Time (in seconds) WLST waits before retiring an application that has been replaced with a newer version. This option default to -1, which specifies graceful timeout.

formElement.label: Upload
formElement.documentation: Optional. Boolean value specifying whether the application files are uploaded to the WebLogic Server Administration Server'â€™s upload directory prior to deployment. Use this option when you are on a different machine from the Administration Server and you cannot copy the deployment files by other means. This option defaults to false.
